rocks.bastion.core

Interface Assertions<M>

  • Type Parameters:
    M - The type of response model the assertions will apply for.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    JsonResponseAssertions, JsonSchemaAssertions, StatusCodeAssertions
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface Assertions<M>
    Specifies assertions to apply to a response model received after performing a Bastion request. The assertions are checked only if Bastion can bind a model object to the response's content successfully.

    Technically, the assertions can be any executable code but it is strongly recommended that a user only performs stateless checks on the provided model and response. If you would like to change the state of the current test you can use the BastionBuilderImpl.thenDo(Callback) method using a Callback. You can also retrieve the returned object using the BastionBuilderImpl.getModel() and BastionBuilderImpl.getResponse() methods.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Assertions<?> NO_ASSERTIONS
      The constant representing the assertions which always pass.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default Assertions<M> and(Assertions<M> after)
      Combine two Assertions objects together by sequential composition.
      void execute(int statusCode, ModelResponse<? extends M> response, M model)
      Asserts that the given response, retrieved after Bastion performs an HTTP request, is correct.
      static <M> Assertions<M> noAssertions()
      Returns a typed no-op assertion which always passes.

    • Field Detail

      • NO_ASSERTIONS

        static final Assertions<?> NO_ASSERTIONS
        The constant representing the assertions which always pass.

    • Method Detail

      • noAssertions

        static <M> Assertions<M> noAssertions()
        Returns a typed no-op assertion which always passes.
        Type Parameters:
        M - The type of response model the assertions will apply for.
        Returns:
        A no-op assertions object which does nothing and always passes.

      • execute

        void execute(int statusCode,
             ModelResponse<? extends M> response,
             M model)
      throws AssertionError
        Asserts that the given response, retrieved after Bastion performs an HTTP request, is correct. To indicate that the response did not pass assertions, this method throws AssertionError. Note that this is important because Bastion makes a distinction between a test containing an error (ie. any exception which is not AssertionError) and one which has a failed assertion. This difference will be made visible in a testing framework which is running a Bastion test.
        Parameters:
        statusCode - The HTTP status code received for the response.
        response - A representation of the HTTP response which was received.
        model - The model object that was created by binding the HTTP response body to an actual Java object.
        Throws:
        AssertionError - Thrown if the HTTP response does not pass the assertions.

      • and

        default Assertions<M> and(Assertions<M> after)
        Combine two Assertions objects together by sequential composition. This function will return a new Assertions object which will first execute this Assertions objects and then execute the Assertions object given as an argument.
        Parameters:
        after - The second Assertions to execute after this one.
        Returns:
        A new Assertions object which executes this and the given argument in sequence.
